# f5xc_cloud_connect (Resource)

Shape of the Cloud Connect specification

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_cloud_connect" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the CloudConnect. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the CloudConnect will be created.

### Optional

- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `aws_tgw_site` (Block, Optional) AWS TGW Site Type. Cloud Connect AWS TGW Site Type (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_tgw_site))
- `azure_vnet_site` (Block, Optional) Azure VNET Site Type. Cloud Connect Azure VNET Site Type (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--azure_vnet_site))
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.
- `segment` (Block, Optional) Object reference. This type establishes a direct reference from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred). Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--segment))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

### Nested Schema for `aws_tgw_site`

Optional:

- `cred` (Block, Optional) Object reference. This type establishes a direct reference from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred). Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_tgw_site--cred))
- `site` (Block, Optional) Object reference. This type establishes a direct reference from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred). Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_tgw_site--site))
- `vpc_attachments` (Block, Optional) VPC Attachments. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_tgw_site--vpc_attachments))

### Nested Schema for `aws_tgw_site.vpc_attachments.vpc_list`

Optional:

- `custom_routing` (Block, Optional) AWS Route Table List. AWS Route Table List (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_tgw_site--vpc_attachments--vpc_list--custom_routing))

- `labels` (Block, Optional) Labels. Add labels for the VPC attachment. These labels can then be used in policies such as enhanced firewall. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_tgw_site--vpc_attachments--vpc_list--labels))
- `manual_routing` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_tgw_site--vpc_attachments--vpc_list--manual_routing))
- `vpc_id` (String) VPC ID. Enter the VPC ID of the VPC to be attached Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 64 ves.io.schema.rules.string.pattern: ^(vpc-)([a-z0-9]{8}|[a-z0-9]{17})$

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_cloud_connect.example system/example
```
